definition: Yongzheng, reign name of Qing emperor (1722-1735)
harmony
surname Yong
old variant of 雍[yong1]
first month of the lunar year
straight/upright/proper/main/principal/to correct/to rectify/exactly/just (at that time)/right (in that place)/(math.) positive

sentences.english: However, the present studies focus on the successes of Yong-Cheng.
sentences.chinese: 然而，综观目前研究，学者多聚焦于雍正帝的功业。

sentences.english: At a depth of twenty or thirty feet there is but little variation from the mean temporature of the year.
sentences.chinese: 正是铁尺，我有一枝类似的铭雍正十年春月。

sentences.english: This is the Nine Dragon Plaque presented by Emperor Yongzheng.
sentences.chinese: 这是雍正皇帝御赐的九龙匾。

sentences.english: The second part is about the cultural self-identity of Machiavellian application in Emperor Yong Zheng.
sentences.chinese: 《雍正皇帝》中的权术运用的文化认同力。

sentences.english: In the first year of Yongzheng, Qing government set up the military exam of Mongolian eight-counties.
sentences.chinese: 雍正元年，清政府开设了八旗蒙古武举。

sentences.english: Junji the first year of the Qing Dynasty changed its name Wei Jingyuan, Yongzheng was renamed eight years Jingyuan County.
sentences.chinese: 清代顺治元年更名靖远卫，雍正八年改称靖远县。

sentences.english: How Emperor Yongzheng usurping the throne was one of the greatest riddles in history of Qing dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 雍正继位问题是清史上最大的谜案之一。

sentences.english: The Yong-zheng"s persecution is the beginning of the hundred years of persecution, have made great influence."
sentences.chinese: 雍正朝的禁教实开“百年禁教”之端，影响巨大。

sentences.english: It is iron ruler, I have one with date: Spring, 15th year, Yongzheng reign, Qing.
sentences.chinese: 正是铁尺，我有一枝类似的铭雍正十年春月。

definition: Qianlong Emperor (1711-1799), sixth Qing emperor, princely title 寶親王|宝亲王[Bao3 Qin1 wang2], personal name 弘曆|弘历[Hong2 li4], reigned 1735-1799

reign name of second Qing emperor (1644-1662)
Jiaqing Emperor (1760-1820), seventh Qing emperor, personal name 顒琰|颙琰[Yong2 yan3], reigned 1796-1820
Fulin Emperor Shunzhi (1638-1662), second Qing emperor, reigned 1644-1662
Heshen (1746-1799), Manchu official of the Qing Dynasty who openly practiced various forms of corruption on a grand scale

Zhang Tingyu (1672-1755), Qing politician, senior minister to three successive emperors, oversaw compilation of History of the Ming Dynasty 明史[Ming2 shi3] and the Kangxi Dictionary 康熙字典[Kang1 xi1 Zi4 dian3]
